name.title: Service name
name.description: The name of this DC/OS DSE instance

service_secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

service_account.description: The principal for the service instance.

user.description: The user that runs the Cassandra nodes and owns the Mesos sandbox.

mesos_api_version.description: Configures the Mesos API version to use. Possible values: V0 (non-HTTP), V1 (HTTP)

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

region.description: All DSE nodes will run in this region.  When no region is specified the nodes are constrained to the local region.

readiness_check.description: Readiness check settings. Excercise caution when modifying these default values as it can lead to spurious task failures.

interval.description: The period in seconds to wait after the last readiness check has completed to start the next check.

delay.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait before starting the readiness check attempts.

timeout.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait for a readiness check to succeed.

external_seeds.title: External seed nodes
external_seeds.description: Comma-separated list of seed hosts for multi-DC operation

count.title: Node count
count.description: Number of DSE nodes in the cluster

virtual_network.description: Name of virtual network for dse node(s) to join

cni_plugin_labels.description: Labels to pass to CNI plugin. Comma-seperated key:value pairs. For example [k_0:v_0,k_1:v_1,...,k_n:v_n]

separate_commit_log_disk.title: Use a separate volume for commit log data?

commit_log_disk_type.title: Persistent commit log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

separate_cdc_log_disk.title: Use a separate volume for cdc log data?

cdc_log_disk_type.title: Persistent cdc log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

native_ssl_port.title: Cassandra native client ssl port (if separate from native_port)

internode_ssl_port.title: Cassandra SSL inter-node cluster communication port

nodetool_cpus.title: How many CPUs needed to execute nodetool command

nodetool_mem.title: How much memory (MB) needed to execute nodetool command

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens randomly assigned to node(s) in a cluster that use vnodes

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster.

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node.

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second.

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff.

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds Cassandra waits before flushing hints from internal buffers to disk.

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs.

authenticator.description: The authentication backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which is used to identify users.

authorizer.description: The authorization backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which limits access and provides permissions.

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications.

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache.

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching.

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls.

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in Mb.

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency.

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates.

performance_max_threads.description: Maximum number of background threads used by the performance service

performance_core_threads.description: Number of background threads used by the performance service

max_memory_to_lock_fraction.description: Specify a fraction of the system memory for DSE In-Memory

dsefs_data_disk_type.description: DSE FS persistent disk type [ROOT, MOUNT]

dsefs_disk.description: DSE File System size in MB

connection_pool_max_active.description: The maximum number of active connections to the LDAP server.

connection_pool_max_idle.description: The maximum number of idle connections in the pool awaiting requests.

conf_driver_pwd_encryption_enabled.description: Set enabled:true on an edge node to collect data in the replication log. Default: false.

security_base_path.description: The base path to prepend to paths in the Advanced Replication configuration locations, including locations to SSL keystore, SSL truststore, and so on.

host.title: OpsCenter Host Name
host.description: Hostname of the opscenter instance to connect to

stomp_port.title: Stomp port
stomp_port.description: Port used for DSE agents to reach OpsCenter

agent_restart_delay_seconds.title: DataStax Agent restart delay in seconds
